original_title: Sri Lanka to get 16,000 tourists from Estonia, Baltic States: Udayanga Weeratunga
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka is expected to receive 16,456 tourists from former Soviet states in Baltic states and Poland via charter flights operated by SkyUp Airlines, former ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga said.
Six flights a week are planned to Sri Lanka’s Mattala airport by Sky Up Airlines in the current winter season, he said.
“I believe Sri Lanka can earn approximately 25 million dollars from these tourists,” Weeratunga said in a statement.
Visitors from Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia, Moldova and Poland, will arrive in the country with tours arranged by JoinUp, a travel agency, Weeratunga said.
Estonia has a population of 1.5 million and so far about 1,100 tourists have to Sri Lanka from that country, he said.
The first SkyUp flight U5-9345 was scheduled to land in the country on December 20 night. (Colombo/Dec20/2023)
